document.title: Healthcare and Human Services Physical Healthcare Subcluster Sports Medicine 3 Course Code: 5557

FD6B81CE92B6443B8BB4F4C233503798.description: Demonstrate use of basic computer operations and file organization.

27B6C88056174588AEA0B105EC53B92C.description: Identify various uses of technology in injury evaluation and tracking systems.

0C0129862C05436E88DE70EFAA86FBCB.description: Use computer applications to create pertinent sports medicine forms and/or presentations including sign in forms, equipment check in/out forms, treatment/rehab forms, etc.

3F61E7091C8E493BBCD5BED12E2ADA1F.description:
Foundation Standard 11: Information Technology Applications
Apply information technology applications common across health professions.

525D537C6B0C4A10B06DDEBAED31DFCF.description: Apply rehab for specific injuries as directed, under the supervision of an AT or licensed sports medicine professional.

4B46DBD7F6CD443A8562B4B86E5FBFE3.description: Demonstrate proficiency in Healthcare Providers (BLS – Basic Life Support) instruction/certification. Students should have their BLS certification before participating in any clinical experience.

58DA37A15EF24DCB8C578E85AE9B5F73.description:
Demonstrate proficiency in locating anatomical landmarks (olecranon process,
lateral malleolus, etc.) as needed, when participating as an athletic training student
aide or work-based learning student.

792B4E47A71240E1BFEBBDE25A4D3FB1.description:
Apply basic taping and wrapping skills for the prevention of common
musculoskeletal injuries when preparing athletes for play, under the supervision of
an AT.

BEF9F45DEC354F1FBF46BA118AA0864B.description:
Apply appropriate stretching techniques to improve musculoskeletal flexibility for
performance under the supervision of a certified athletic trainer (AT) or other licensed sports medicine professional (including but not limited to a physical or
occupational therapist).

A3A383E0ECD342A9BBC822A2A94CDDAC.description:
Demonstrate proficiency in taking vital signs and communicating abnormal ranges
to the athletic trainer or licensed physical/occupational therapist supervisor as
needed while participating as an athletic trainer student aide and work-based
learning student.

EFBFFFB518C34EC0B8558129E7F70BFD.description:
Foundation Standard 10: Technical Skills
Apply and demonstrate technical skills and knowledge as appropriate while participating
as an athletic training student aide or work-based learning student, under the supervision
of a sports medicine professional.

DF08792BC9CB4B77B0F93DEC2F81D4BF.description: Discuss nutritional concerns of the athlete such as:

B6B55CDB19974981BF06BB24FCFED5A8.description: Recognize drug and alcohol use, abuse, and treatment protocols after an athlete tests positive.

11EE61B4A1114D62AFEB58FBD5148CC5.description: Explain how the complications of circadian dysrhythmias could affect various levels of athletes.

F1FAF53F83C84BF585863F13199316A6.description: List socially used drugs and problems associated with athletics and performance.

4483BFE0370343D9997A5703FA5C4D16.description:
Define the social drugs misused by athletes and the importance of drug testing in
athletics.

CF659ADA455940B5846135BF47A8351B.description:
Review safety guidelines associated with proper medication use and how it affects
an athlete and their performance.

1FDEAF5908BA49548994AE49B9399F45.description:
Describe the use and delivery of therapeutic drugs in sports medicine and who is
allowed to prescribe and dispense the medication.

A4528DAB9062464C9563F4B48BBA91D5.description:
Foundation Standard 9: Health Maintenance Practices
Differentiate between wellness and disease. Promote disease prevention and model
healthy behaviors.

2793F4924EF6483280D46C65CD7B897A.description: Discuss scheduling in a sports medicine facility

D6D58129B213491397A5A15E2F03476C.description: Recognize methods for building positive team relationships.

567A158945B945D3BE3042B3FD606ACD.description: Recognize the various job responsibilities within the sports medicine team and how those parts work together. 3. Recognize methods for building positive team relationships. 4. Discuss scheduling in a sports medicine facility

2777B88069A04FE3AB97EB8F9237F67A.description: Define effective team member responsibilities for athletic training student aides

75E7F33232834EB7923E086B85F33D04.description:
Foundation Standard 8: Teamwork
Identify roles and responsibilities of individual members as part of the healthcare team.

6A55D84E690846399F1DEF5243C7B937.description: Review emergency equipment tools such as: helmet removal tools, WBGT devices, rectal thermometers and other environmental monitors.

7BB7C10B514D4DE59E2F983BE22D886F.description: Demonstrate appropriate use of infectious disease control measures as established by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) and the Center for Disease Control (CDC) including but not limited to procedure of disposal of sharps and biohazard wastes.

1F0AAEB1F04C45528230EF59CBD486E7.description:
Explain the importance of appropriate sports medicine and athletic facility
inspections and maintenance including but not limited to modality calibration.

80CC69719E02448AA56083C3DFA08611.description:
Foundation Standard 7: Safety Practices
Identify existing and potential hazards to clients, co-workers, and self. Employ safe work
practices and follow health and safety policies and procedures to prevent injury and
illness.

F114752B409B4C71A7AAA8A0CFEB2BC3.description: Review laws as applicable to athletic trainer student assistants such as Title IX, and the “Good Samaritan Law”

3E45080B0E4B4FB4913B2A7CE93A23CE.description: Differentiate between employer’s liability insurance and personal liability insurance.

5521CC05E9294BA59B4CC0F10BBA5E4A.description: Define ways that athletic trainers and coaches can refrain from litigation.

A9F1594B61A4461F8C24596AFB8DE892.description:
Differentiate between ethical and legal issues and practices impacting sports
medicine professionals. Be able to identify the scenarios of:

AF281252B4184CAA93897D5E570E149E.description:
Critique ethical, respectful, and empathetic behaviors throughout scenarios
presented in class and lab activities.

04DD84CB952940A894C8B624E510D7AA.description:
Foundation Standard 6: Ethics
Understand accepted ethical practices with respect to cultural, social, and ethnic
differences within the healthcare environment.

822D10981185478BBDB424440E8C35E2.description: Apply procedures for proper documentation and storage of medical records.

8033633E13F2482284E66F2A4E1A96C2.description: Compare and contrast scope of practice among:

5E049D401445432B8150002A9AE8EA86.description: Identify the work ethic necessary to work in the sports medicine field.

D5E8F51F48884B8999C39310976CE790.description:
Foundation Standard 5: Legal Responsibilities
Describe legal responsibilities, limitations, and implications on healthcare worker actions.

E5048414BBA44B729682CA5675EC9780.description: Demonstrate basic professional standards as they apply to hygiene, dress, language, confidentiality, and behavior.

CE2FC4B8DE0E47A4BF9D17250E1A2BA6.description: Develop a resume for a career in sports medicine.

A6F4DBD8D4BB41BE855AC400ACA65907.description: student and professional organizations documentation and recognition, etc.

F6E4C8623FF64F569DF2E70135413BDD.description: Develop and expand components of a personal portfolio to potentially include:

85B04AA535194CC9BFA1B0DA3E372F16.description:
Foundation Standard 4: Employability Skills
Use employability skills to enhance employment opportunities and job satisfaction.

D4E88A279C134273B46D2249369D61CB.description: Describe the budgeting and purchasing process for a sports medicine program

5B4392579DF546DBBF83B51BD6D8AA7A.description: Compare and contrast options within healthcare delivery systems, including:

647C58499B5845FCAEA7228D1E18FDB8.description: Analyze differences in various healthcare payment methods.

DA32FDD462CD49ED83C6FC76B90CAA40.description: Analyze various healthcare payment methods and insurance claims.

97FB388312D449FEB6AB51BB88285ADB.description: Develop educational materials to encourage the proper selection of medical facilities and providers based on current conditions (ER, urgent care, family physician, specialist, etc.).

30CF377CD6D7475E8ED0DC5AAF3302A0.description: Develop educational materials to enable constituents to properly select and utilize medical insurance.

BC30AB4B04E24492A832103FAD7EABE1.description: Develop intervention strategies based on injury and athletic training room statistics.

3AC478C816A940BFA35D0C37FF62806A.description: Analyze injury and athletic training room statistics.

0F46800E157F431AAE12A4EA4B290F4F.description:
Foundation Standard 3: Systems
Identify how key systems affect services performed and quality of care.

0C489DCF87BD48E68EC7325CFB3587C9.description: Demonstrate elements of written and electronic communication (spelling, grammar, formatting, and confidentiality) to develop injury reports and daily coach’s injury reports.

78E42F6908EC428F9420C0376E4470AB.description: Design athletic training room forms such as treatment logs, rehabilitation records, emergency information cards, and consent forms.

C69E01E401554F4F8CB16E81440177ED.description:
Design injury reports, referral, rehab plan, and clearance forms, in order to
appropriately communicate injury information with coaches, parents, team
physicians, and other sports medicine professionals.

E0D8B3E7405B418B9B72060B85EC3DEC.description:
Foundation Standard 2: Communications
Demonstrate methods of delivering and obtaining information, while communicating
effectively

E42A705514854C99BC32F51CF8D4ADE6.description: Identify common chronic health conditions in athletes and how they affect performance.

C5539182A0254163BCEAA2A77DC670E1.description: Describe the benefits of exercise on the body.

B5C77165DAFD4229942324C2670E6235.description: Describe and demonstrate different “Return to Play” protocols for various injuries.

0F73FDD89DEF48DD983B04318428FA24.description: Describe the benefits of various therapeutic modalities and how they are utilized in sports medicine.

355B229FA1394E27A00028D6509340F5.description: Describe the components of the sports psychology of injuries, including but not limited to, overtraining and burnout.

CCF487637C244306819D056684EADF00.description: Identify forms of performing rehabilitation for specific injuries.

2158EC0F9A1A4057B685EE0785153D45.description: Identify the techniques of assessing injuries including obtaining medical histories and evaluating techniques.

FE3E31E904FE46748F56A45AF97EDF25.description:
Describe the various forms of documenting injuries including written and electronic
forms.

333A7112F34F4FE7BACFF750FD6D7F1F.description:
Foundation Standard 1: Academic Foundation
Understand human anatomy, physiology, common diseases and disorders, and medical
math principles.
